node.title: Understanding the Mesh: Observability in a Cloud Native World
node.excerpt: Here Kevin Crawley, Developer Advocate, introduces the fundamentals of tracing and metrics, how they work, and what benefits and limitations you can expect when making the decision to instrument your load balancers, proxies, meshes, and applications.
node.custom_excerpt: Here Kevin Crawley, Developer Advocate, introduces the fundamentals of tracing and metrics, how they work, and what benefits and limitations you can expect when making the decision to instrument your load balancers, proxies, meshes, and applications.
node.meta_title: Understanding Service Mesh: Observability in a Cloud Native World
node.meta_description: In this meetup, we explore a realistic microservice application running in Kubernetes with both ingress and internal traffic managed by Traefik and Maesh.
node.plaintext:

node.title: Managing Traffic Everywhere: Bare Metal to Containers to the Public Cloud
node.excerpt: Join us as Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s infrastructure.
node.custom_excerpt: Join us as Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s infrastructure.
node.meta_title: Managing Traefik in Bare Metal, Containers & Public Cloud With Traefik
node.meta_description: This session demonstrates how William & Mary, the top university, uses Traefik to manage a heterogeneous infrastructure, using Docker Swarm and Kubernetes.
node.plaintext:
William & Mary’s IT department supports a wide range of services. Some are
delivered directly from bare metal to the client while others run in
auto-scaling container clusters. Here Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at
William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s
infrastructure.
node.html: William & Mary’s IT department supports a wide range of services. Some are delivered directly from bare metal to the client while others run in auto-scaling container clusters. Here Phil Fenstermacher, Lead Linux engineer at William & Mary, demos how they are using Traefik to manage William & Mary’s infrastructure.

node.title: Tweaking Requests with Traefik Middlewares
node.excerpt: There are several middlewares available in Traefik. During this webinar, we go through Traefik's middlewares, and shows how to reduce software development costs, in a live demo of the middlewares in action.
node.custom_excerpt: There are several middlewares available in Traefik. During this webinar, we go through Traefik's middlewares, and shows how to reduce software development costs, in a live demo of the middlewares in action.

node.title: Traefik 2.x Features
node.excerpt: Traefik and MSHOWTO Webinar Series, Part II, demonstrates how to use Traefik running on a Kubernetes cluster to improve release cycles using canary deployments, and offers a live demo of deploying Traefik on K3s.

node.title: Easily Deploy the Reaction Commerce Platform from Mailchimp with Traefik 2 on Digital Ocean
node.excerpt: This presentation provides a guided tour of how to deploy Reaction Commerce’s core services: Core API, Admin UI, Storefront, OAuth 2 Server and Identity Provider on Digital Ocean, from Mailchimp with Traefik 2.

node.title: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik
node.excerpt: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik presented by James Pic, CTO, YourLabs.
node.custom_excerpt: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik presented by James Pic, CTO, YourLabs.
node.meta_title: Practice of eXtreme DevOps with Traefik presented by James Pic, CTO, YourLabs
node.meta_description: eXtreme DevOps is the practice of an extremely aggressive Continuous Delivery strategy where each patch push deploys an ephemeral deployment such as branchname.ci.example.com.
node.plaintext:
eXtreme DevOps is the practice of an extremely aggressive Continuous Delivery
strategy where each patch push deploys an ephemeral deployment such as
branchname.ci.example.com. With Traefik, it's easy to do, and James Pic makes it
the standard practice for his customers, from private companies of all sizes,
and to government organizations. In this session, James demos his expertise
using Traefik to practice eXtreme DevOps for his customers.
node.html: eXtreme DevOps is the practice of an extremely aggressive Continuous Delivery strategy where each patch push deploys an ephemeral deployment such as branchname.ci.example.com. With Traefik, it's easy to do, and James Pic makes it the standard practice for his customers, from private companies of all sizes, and to government organizations. In this session, James demos his expertise using Traefik to practice eXtreme DevOps for his customers.
